ratings.rComments: Best teacher I've ever had. As long as you do not cheat or take advantage of him like MATH 408 did then you should have no problems with him. Very helpful especially during office hours and is very good at teaching the material. Does a great job of not making the class boring with all his stories and jokes, although not always funny, appreciated.
Great teacher!!!

Alex, I know you are conscious of these comments enough to read them off during classes. Please stop wasting student's time during classes. I took more than 85 credits so far, and you were the worst teacher I've ever met, congrat. Most inaccessible, rude, and unhelpful. I got above 97% on your class, so don't assume I am mad at you for grades.

Stochastic Processes class is not for faint-hearted.  Homeworks test your ability to write proofs, so if you lack  preparation, good luck. Exams test your ability to memorize rare non-proof examples from homeworks and speed. The amount of material covered is huge, but examples are few and speed at which Alex goes is beyond average undergrad Xiao.

Personally my favorite professor in UIUC. His lectures and notes are extremely structured and detailed, from intuition to "silly" examples to more complicated ones. His jokes and self-deprecating humor make lectures engaging and fun. I find him patient, knowledgeable and personable. Respect is reciprocal; pay attention in class and don't cheat (:

He is NOT a jerk! Literally one of the best professors I've ever had with respect to lecturing style. Everything he says makes sense, as opposed to my CS professors that go on and on about some they probably don't even understand. He presents the material with examples and theoretical underpinnings, but he explains them in a great way. NOT a jerk!!

I can't believe people actually like this guy. In one word, he's a jerk.  I once needed help on a HW problem and asked him in office hours for help clarifying the question. The next day in lecture, he actually announced to the class not to come to him with bad questions. In major advising, he has been pretentious and curt. Very disrespectful

Stepanov is great. All around. Best Act-Sci teacher her considered Gorvett and PJ are gone. He's the only hope this program has. Take him, actually DO the homework. You'll find answers online, and you will do poorly on tests. Just suck it up, get a group together, order pizza, and do the hw... it'll make the tests super simple. GREAT GUY.

He is easily the best teacher I ever had in UIUC. I have my classes: Math 408 and 409 taught by him and learn a lot from him. Homeworks are VERY TOUGH but the exam is pretty straightforward. He declare himself as mean but he is actually very nice and really willing to help the students to learn and understand the material.

Alex is easily the best professor I've had in college. He is funny and very helpful and teaches the material very well. The class has very tough homework but it prepares you extremely well for the exams and quizzes. Very helpful in class but he will get mad if the class doesn't participate or show up.

Alex is my favorite professor so far! It was great to take STAT 400 with him during the summer, and I will definitely take his class again if I can get in. He has a sense of humor, and is very helpful and friendly to students. He can get very scary if you cheated on homework/exams (eg. if you copy other student's homework...) so don't do that!

If you're thinking about taking any Stat class at UIUC, then definitely take it with Alex! First of all, he is mean! He is always well prepared for the lectures. Don't bother buying the book, 'cause Prof Stepanov is the living book! He knows everything! Go Alex!
Tests aren't bad but try not to get on his bad side as he has accused students of cheating for using example problems (that he has given in class) to do the homework and tests
Glad to have him as the professor. Took Exam P and passed right after the final. This class is perfect for actuarial science students. HWs are tough, but prepare you well for everything.

Probably the funniest professor I've ever had - he made showing up to 3:00 lectures 100% worth it.  Never moved on to a new concept unless all questions were answered.  HWs are difficult BUT prepare you well for the tests which are much easier and very fair.  Overall, you can tell he loved teaching and is very good at it - highly recommend him!!
He is amazing!!!!!!!!! Very nice person and he explains everything clearly.
Alex is mean.
If you have a sense of humor you'll enjoy his lectures.   Take the homework and practice problems seriously and you'll do fine in the class and on tests and quizzes
You have to take this class with Stepanov. He's amazing!

Excellent lecturer! By attending STATS 400 you feel more like in the comedy club. He likes picking on students, so do not leave in the middle of the lecture. Likes participation. No curve, homework is once every 2 weeks and is hard. Quizes are a joke. Exams are easier than HW. Highly recommended!

I love having Stepanov as my professor. He's really clear and provide examples in classes. Homework load for MATH408 is quite a lot, but it is very helpful for exams. He's funny as well. He said that he's a mean person, but that's not true. He's one of the nicest professor I've known!
A friendly but grumpy guy. Tests are fair game.

He is the BEST professor I have ever met in this university. He is sooo funny and always joke. I love taking his class and really miss it especially when I take another statistics class this semester with another professor.

He is the best professor I have ever met. His jokes in class keeps it interesting and fun. He tries very hard to encourage participation which was a big challenge. Overall if you are taking any stats class make sure you take his class!
He is one of the best professors in Department of Statistics. His lecture is very helpful for Actuarial exam P and C. If you have an opportunity to take his class, take it, you will learn a lot!!
Best professor! He claims that he's a horrible person (H0: Alex = horrible person) but I'm sure that claim will fall into rejection region. You'll understand what I'm saying once you take the class.

He was fantastic! I went to his class everyday and actually participated. B/c of that he was always willing to help me, so actually interact with him. He is funny and knows his stuff. The HW can be hard, but work with other people. I was glad to have him as a professor.

Homework is very difficult but once you get over it, exam is just a piece of cake.You'll be very grateful for having Alex as your instructor especially when you are sitting for exam P. Alex is a very good dry joke teller and definitely has some flexible bones. However, please be careful, sometimes he can be quite dangerous.

Fantastic professor. Exams are taken right from in-class examples, and are easy as long as you make good use of your note sheets (put example problems on them and you're golden). Stepanov made STAT 400 easier than STAT 200. Take his class whenever possible.
He is a great instructor and nice person. In addition, his class is easy A.

Greatest professor ever, his lecture slides are all available on the compass with solutions. Homework are nearly the same as the questions on the slides, so do the exams. Go to lectures and go over the slides. A in hand.
Take his class if there is one. Class contents and homework are difficult, but exams are very easy as long as you have  comprehensive formula sheets~

Very clear, very passionate, and very funny (well if you're into dry, cheesy humor). Favorite stats prof here. Notes help out a ton with HW and exams. Exams are very similar to HW. No surprises. Encourages participation, which is good. Fair and Reasonable as a whole. Wish he taught more classes.

His personality makes the class interesting. He's kind of mean, but you get over it after a few weeks. Otherwise, his lectures are example filled, which I liked very much. Homework is very difficult but very similar to exams. With that being said exams have no surprises so they are pretty easy. Fair grader, would definitely recommend.

I must say he has a great passion for teaching and he does enjoy it. However, I strongly dislike his teaching methodology. He does not care whether students are able to understand and follow what he teaches. And the worst part he spends 80% of class time in solving examples (sheer mathematical calculation) and focuses least on explaining concepts.
One of the best math professors I've had. Class is interesting because of his jokes. :)
He is the best lecturer I've ever had!

Very well organized course. He is very up to date with posting content on compass despite what he says. He is a good guy and he truly wants his students to succeed. Would recommend. He also looked at this site one day while in class and showed the students his reviews. "Let me erase all of this before you copy it down..."

Stepanov is the man. Everything is posted online to review. The homework is tough but prepares you for the milder exams. This was one of the best classes I've taken at U of I, incredibly organized for a 400 math class where teachers can tend to be all over the place. He keeps lecture interesting, very funny guy.
Awesome Prof... Take Stat 400 with him and you will not regret it
All midterms are fair but final exam is getting a little harder. Maybe only my fault cause so many As around me.
Keeps on blabering in class. His  notes are undoubtedly good and well organized, but his style of teaching sucks

This man is hilarious, and an excellent teacher.  He is able to maintain concentration of class in what is not a very interesting subject.  He was really mad one day, but the rest of the time was very pleasant and helpful.

He is too good. Just too good! He can explain anything about statistics and mathematics. Extremely clear! Very smart professor! But his behavior is a little bit hard to understand, occasionally. His temper is somewhat unstable.
Excellent professor! He knows everything about Statistics!

The conciseness of his notes, in-depth knowledge of his field, and kindness normally reserved to being emitted by a carebear make him a professor that makes UIUC known. Make no mistake, he is a very fair and helpful professor. You will learn a lot from him. Also, his lectures are fascinating and humorous. Lastly, he goes above the call to answer Qs

The best professor I?ve ever had! You learn a LOT in his class. The lectures are well organized & he explains really well. Stepanov has a great sense of humor. It?s amazing how he makes learning such a dry subject so much fun.  It?s obvious that he is passionate about teaching. I really enjoyed his class.
Alex is great. He's really entertaining and it keeps the class interesting. He provides example sheets for every class, which are incredibly helpful when doing homework and preparing for exams.

In terms of teaching, he is the best instructor I have ever seen for about 10 years of my campus life in undergraduate and graduate schools. He knows really well what are important for his students and is very good at explaining hard materials very easily. I was into his jokes!!! I never got bored in his class. I already miss him a lot.

In terms of teaching, he is the best instructor I have ever seen for about 10 years of my campus life in undergraduate and graduate schools. He knows really well what are important for his students and is very good at explaining hard materials very easily. I was into his jokes!!! I never got bored in his class. I already miss him a lot.
Great professor! Second class I've taken with him.  Always willing to help students. LOVES whens students ask questions.  Easy to get on his good side.
The worst teacher I ever meet!!!!!!!! The course is really easy. But I doubt his moral quality. So bad.

Alex worked hard on his lectures and was always prepared. He's also a really smart guy despite how he says he's dumb... He can be really moody, but he can also be pretty funny. Very quirky professor. He is sarcastic at times, but generally it's funny. He is also really fair  from my experience. HW is hard, but worth it. Take class with Alex.
Had him for Math 408,409 and Stat 420. He rocks! Very engaging (sometimes goes lunatic) but a caring, helpful and unforgettable lecturer nonetheless. Will miss him!
He is the man!!
Awesome prof.  The homework is difficult but if you do it all you can get A's on every exam.  Very fair and helpful.
He is super nice and really cares about his student :D

This is the second time I took his class. He is by far one of the best teachers on campus I've met. The test is easy. He gave out extra credits for this summer class. The homeworks are relatively hard, so as long as you understand what you are doing in the homeworks, you'll do great on the exams.

I loved having class with Alex. I did well in this class only because I went to office hours- he was extremely helpful and made sure you understood the material. Discussion is useless, except for taking quizzes, which are easy. Homework is difficult and takes forever, but helps for the tests. Tests are fair. I only used the textbook for homework

Alex is awesome! If you actually take time to ask him any kind of questions, he will *make sure* you understand the material. He did seemed to go off topic during the lecture, but that's probably some part of his awesomeness... and his squirrels and polar bears :-D

Textbook is useless but only because Alex is the best professor I've had on campus. He really cares about the students and has an amazing sense of humor. He gets mad if the class doesn't participate, but if you do, he'll love you.  Also, homework is hard, but it's only to prepare you and his tests aren't horrible. No curve at all, but class is fair

He's such a great instructor.Love to make jokes in class. His homework aint that hard if you start doing it a bit earlier.Or else, will end up finishing in 6 hours.I would highly recommend him for math409 and math469.Actuarial sc, u gotta love him!:P

He really cares about the students, which is a nice change from other classes of this size. He expects a lot but not excessive amounts. You will have several hours of homework but since it is preparing you for an actuarial exam it's not excessive either. Ask questions he'll answer them well. In the end you get out what you put in..I'd recommend him

He is not horrible teacher and his exams are fair.  BUT he rants and complains instead of teaching for about 40% of class time.  He assigns over 6 hours of homework every week, even on exam weeks. I wouldn't recommend him but Acutarial students are pretty much stuck with him!

This professor does not show how to do problems. He will just make jokes for most of the class instead of teach. He does a poor job of writing notes and will either erase what he's written or explain things while you're still copying so that you can't get everything down. His tests are fair, though. Overall, he's a bad teacher but nice guy.

He is not a very hard teacher yet he gives a ton of homework which a lot of the time is just useless and way to long. Espeically he gives homework during weeks of exams which sucks. He gets off topic a little too much but does teach the material well. If you don't like doing 6-10 hours of homework a week, try to take someone else.
Good, not great. He was funny, direct, and had reasonable exams. But he imposes poor effort of the few onto the masses as if everyone is as smart as he is.
Easy class; He is incredibly invested in his students and willing to go the extra mile outside of class. If you have a choice, take him. If he's your only choice, be happy :)

I had him for 409 and was thrilled to come back for 420. Best professor I've had! Very helpful in and outside of class. Be sure to ask him about his cool tricks that he likes to show off for the class. Tests are fair and straightforward. Homework is challenging but fair.

Amazing professor!!! Basically a kid at heart and loves to joke around. Is very willing to help outside of class and (if you attend class and he gets to know you) is one of the most down-to-earth professors on campus.
He is just great.
Fun, knowledgable, extremely willing to help and see his students succeed.

Professor Stepanov is an awesome professor. Though he's not always 100% clear in his lectures, he'll stay with you at his office hours till you understand the material. The exams aren't too bad, just study the examples and old homework problems. The book's pretty useless though.
Doesn't talk very loud, so sit in the front of the room if you want to hear what he is saying.
He's a very good lecturer. Willing to help outside class. Discussion needn't attend. Many TAs office hrs. Exams are not that hard if study the study materials he posted. Definitely a taker!

Alex is the man!!! I came into this class not understanding statistics at all, and now I totally get it.  Plus he's a raving lunatic from Siberia.  About the only problem is that occasionally he gets too caught-up in imaginary emotional drama with the class and forgets to teach for a few minutes.  Exams are not hard at all provided you did the hw.
kick ass

Gets mad at students for not coming to class and for not putting in enough effort.  Its kinda like high school.  Pretty easy class, more work than I wanted STAT 100 to be, but its very possible to do well.  Very doable, but a bit unpleasant.  Take Fireman if you can.

Great professor, very helpful, funny, and nice! Material is easy and he explains very well. Tests and homeworks are pretty easy. If you show up to lecture, you'll be fine in the class. Looking forward to him in 469!

Alex is a good teacher just likes to jump around a lot. He gives out tons of extra credit and if you try a little you probably will get a good grade.  He likes to go on tangents about nothing and that can get confusing.  He also like to get mad at the students about not coming to class, not getting good grades etc.  But overall not a bad class

He is a very funny and friendly teacher, but has times where he gets mad at the students either for not participating or making stupid mistakes on exams. He makes corny jokes that keep the class interesting, and provides worksheets which contain example that are exactly like test questions. He also gives extra credit and is a very lenient grader.

Awesome professor. Makes class fun. He is strictly against curves, but offers extra credit opportunities to make up for it. Appreciates class participation and is always willing to help in and out of class.

Class is extremely easy if you are reasonably intelligent. Worksheets filled in during class are amazingly helpful. Overall very funny, hyper guy. Loves what he does which makes class enjoyable. Best professor I've had this year
awesome prof
Best professor at U of I.  Great teaching skills.  Kept the material interesting and exciting.
Overall a good professor and very knowledgable, but he speaks rather quietly and without a microphone, so get a seat up front. Has a tendency to flip out from time to time.

Some of the concepts in the class might be difficult, but Alex DEFINITELY deserves a 5 for helpfullness and clarity.  He goes above and beyond what is required and portrayed by the average professor.  He is MORE than willing to help with not only his classes but others in which he has knowledge as well.  The best professor I've had in my 4 yrs here
No Comments
